instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00170 20V 0A to 1A and reboot
threads.message:
Lo liquid damage.
At first there was 5V and 0.45A from charger.
Found U9580 was getting hot and there was no short around that IC.
Replaced U9580 and its not getting hot anymore and board switch to 20V and wont boot.

PP2V5_NAND_SSD0 got 2.51V.

There is 20V on charger and it take up to 1A and reboot.
Cant go in to DFU.

Any idea?

threads.title: 820-00170 20V 0A to 1A and reboot
threads.message:
Did you test with original 96/140W charger?
Test connecting known good battery also.
USB-C meter shows steady 20V or cycles too?

threads.title: 820-00170 20V 0A to 1A and reboot
threads.message:
Original 96W charger and know good batt.
Steady 20V, no cycles.

threads.title: 820-00170 20V 0A to 1A and reboot
threads.message:
"There is 20V on charger and it take up to 1A and reboot."
Do you mean 0-1A on USB meter, but no black screen on it?

threads.title: 820-00170 20V 0A to 1A and reboot
threads.message: Yes, 0A-1A on USB meter and screen stays black.

threads.title: 820-00170 20V 0A to 1A and reboot
threads.message:
How can you see meter indication if [U]ITS[/U] screen is black???
I didn't ask about laptop screen.

I want to know if ampmeter restarts itself, or just fluctuates 0-1A.
I'm not sure what mentioned "reboot" means in this case.

threads.title: 820-00170 20V 0A to 1A and reboot
threads.message:
Sorry for misinformation.

USB meter stays at 20V and it shows some cycles from 0A up to 1A and then again from 0A up to 1A. 
Cycle take around 10-15 seconds.

Trackpad is clickable but when there is drop from 1A to 0A for short time is not clickable.

threads.title: 820-00170 20V 0A to 1A and reboot
threads.message:
Possibly damaged SSD.
Compare diode mode readings between L9080/580.

Do you get voltage on any SSD coil?

threads.title: 820-00170 20V 0A to 1A and reboot
threads.message:
Got correct voltages on SSD coils on 2.5V, 1.8V and 0.9V rails.

Diode mode:
L9080 0.048V
L9580 0.034V

threads.title: 820-00170 20V 0A to 1A and reboot
threads.message: Not short, but damage on SSD can't be discarded...
